1. Exception Handling¶

Todo

Intro to Sinon exception handling.

1.1. Exceptions – sinon.exceptions¶

exception sinon.exceptions.SinonException(msg, obj=None)[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Parameters:
  • msg (string) – Error message, indicating the cause for the exception being raised.
  • obj (object) – Sinon object on whose activity the exception was raised.
Raises :

–

The base class for all Sinon Exception classes – this exception type is never raised directly, but can be used to catch all Sinon exceptions within a single except clause.

The exception message and originating object are also accessable as class attributes (e.object() and e.message()). The __str__() operator redirects to get_message().

get_object()[source]¶

Return the object instance on whose activity the exception was raised.

get_message()[source]¶

Return the error message associated with the exception

exception sinon.exceptions.IncorrectURL(msg, obj=None)[source]¶

Bases: sinon.exceptions.SinonException

Parameters:msg (string) – Error message, indicating the cause for the exception being raised.
Raises :–

The given URL could not be interpreted, for example due to an incorrect / unknown schema.

exception sinon.exceptions.BadParameter(msg, obj=None)[source]¶

Bases: sinon.exceptions.SinonException

Parameters:msg (string) – Error message, indicating the cause for the exception being raised.
Raises :–

A given parameter is out of bound or ill formatted.

exception sinon.exceptions.DoesNotExist(msg, obj=None)[source]¶

Bases: sinon.exceptions.SinonException

Parameters:msg (string) – Error message, indicating the cause for the exception being raised.
Raises :–

An operation tried to access a non-existing entity.

exception sinon.exceptions.IncorrectState(msg, obj=None)[source]¶

Bases: sinon.exceptions.SinonException

Parameters:msg (string) – Error message, indicating the cause for the exception being raised.
Raises :–

The operation is not allowed on the entity in its current state.

exception sinon.exceptions.PermissionDenied(msg, obj=None)[source]¶

Bases: sinon.exceptions.SinonException

Parameters:msg (string) – Error message, indicating the cause for the exception being raised.
Raises :–

The used identity is not permitted to perform the requested operation.

exception sinon.exceptions.AuthorizationFailed(msg, obj=None)[source]¶

Bases: sinon.exceptions.SinonException

Parameters:msg (string) – Error message, indicating the cause for the exception being raised.
Raises :–

The backend could not accept the given identity.

exception sinon.exceptions.AuthenticationFailed(msg, obj=None)[source]¶

Bases: sinon.exceptions.SinonException

Parameters:msg (string) – Error message, indicating the cause for the exception being raised.
Raises :–

The backend could not establish a valid identity.

exception sinon.exceptions.Timeout(msg, obj=None)[source]¶

Bases: sinon.exceptions.SinonException

Parameters:msg (string) – Error message, indicating the cause for the exception being raised.
Raises :–

The interaction with the backend timed out.

exception sinon.exceptions.NoSuccess(msg, obj=None)[source]¶

Bases: sinon.exceptions.SinonException

Parameters:msg (string) – Error message, indicating the cause for the exception being raised.
Raises :–

Some unsopecified error occurred.
